main event: Two objects, hazy and brownish in appearance, were observed at Lake Nottawa, Michigan, on July 1, 1960, moving behind trees and disappearing at high speed.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be half the diameter of the Moon,The witnesses noted that there was no sound or trail emitted by the objects,The objects were observed moving in different directions at a rapid rate, The conclusion of the sighting was that there was insufficient data for evaluation, The report details several witness accounts over days leading to a broader investigation request.
witness description: reliable and cooperative witnesses, one was familiar with various airborne objects
